children.text: There are visible defects and poorly finished sections of staining on the timber stairs.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 12.02 Surface Finish of Paintwork, states
‘Paintwork is defective if application defects or blemishes such as paint runs, paint sags, wrinkling,

dust, bare or starved painted areas, colour variation, surface cracks, irregular and course brush marks, sanding marks, blistering, uniformity of gloss level and other irregularities in the surface are visible from a normal viewing position’ .
These timber stairs will need to be sanded back prior to re-staining.
